title: As a user I want the updated ts and user on the eligible for dugout utility to correctly reflect only changes made on the utility
custom_steps:
The updated ts and user fields on the eligible for dugout utility should only be modified when a user makes a change on the actual utility.  The nightly batch updating the values or a transaction making a change behind the scenes should not modify those values.  

Additionally, the values should be specific to the displayed club rather than the latest value for all clubs.  If ARI is selected, the value should be the last update for ARI (and not for ATL, BAL, etc)

[https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/EBISII-20795|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/EBISII-20795|smart-link] was implemented to temporarily hide the invalid fields and will be invalidated by this update.

title: As a Club domestic social media monitoring editor I want to be able to create reports for Domestic amateur players from the social media monitoring widget
custom_steps:
Club users with the Domestic Amateur Social Media Monitoring editor permission will be able to take the following actions on the social media monitoring widget when domestic players are selected:

Each row will have a â€˜Create Reportâ€™ button which, when clicked will display a confirm dialog and after clicking â€˜yesâ€™ will create a new social media report for the player.

Reports requested by a club user should show on the BOC version of the widget as â€˜club reportâ€™ rows.

title: As a BOC domestic social media monitoring editor I want to be able to create reports for Domestic amateur players from the social media monitoring widget
custom_steps:
BOC users with the Domestic Amateur Social Media Monitoring editor permission will be able to take the following actions on the social media monitoring widget when domestic players are selected: 

Each non â€˜club reportâ€™ row will have a â€˜create reportâ€™ button.  Clicking this button will display a confirmation dialog and selection okay will create a BOC social media screening for the player.

There will be a footer button â€˜Create reportâ€™ with two choices â€˜All playersâ€™ and â€˜All top playersâ€™.

selecting all top players will display a confirmation dialog and after clicking okay will create reports for all top players listed on the widget

selecting all players will display a confirmation dialog and after clicking okay will create reports for all players listed on the widget

Reports created by BOC user should be visible to any club users who have access to the widget (as well as reports they have requested).

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to update the wording on the Elig for Bench Utility
custom_steps:
AC:

* The â€˜Uniformâ€™ column will be renamed to â€œOn Fieldâ€�
* The header text will be reworded to: â€œX out of Y on field coaches selectedâ€�

title: As a BOC Admin, I want MN COVID IL Players to Count Against the 180 Org Limit
custom_steps:
Currently, players on the MN COVID IL do not count against the domestic reserve list total

AC:

* Players on the MN COVID IL will count against the domestic reserve list total

title: As a BOC Admin, I want MJ COVID IL Players to Count Against 40-Man Limit
custom_preconds: Currently, players on the MJ COVID IL appear on the 40-Man roster but do not count against the limit.
custom_steps: WHEN a user places a player on the MJ COVID IL list
custom_expected: THEN Players on the MJ COVID IL will count towards the 40-Man Limit

title: As a Club MNC Admin, I want to see a flag on my Add C widget if a MLS player is making below the MN Minimum
custom_steps:
AC:

* There will be a new flag column added to the Club Add C widget
* When a player with MLS has an Add C that is below the Minimum Minor League Salary LRD (system value), there will be a flag displayed in the flag column of the Clubâ€™s Addendum C widget
** To calculate find the weekly value of the MJ Minimum: (Min MN Salary / 186) * 7. 
** If the playerâ€™s AAA weekly salary is greater than the MN weekly value, do nothing.
** If the playerâ€™s AAA weekly salary is greater than the MN weekly value, set flag.
* The flag will read:
** Player has MLS and salary is below the MN Minimum.

title: Requirement Clarifications: Eligible For Dugout Utility to drive which employees appear on printed rosters
custom_steps:
Should show on roster only be available for MAJ employees?
- currently employees at any level can be checked in the eligible for dugout utility as Show on Roster, but only MAJ employees show on roster reports
- unlikely that a Mn emp would ever be selected

title: As an MNC Admin, I want to see a clipboard flag if a MLS player will be making below the minimum
As a BOC MNC Admin, I want to see a flag on the BOC's Add C widget if a MLS player is making below the MN Minimum
custom_steps:
Business Value:  When a player has MLS, his minor league salary must be above the Minimum Minor League Salary LRD (system value).  EBIS currently has no notification or flag to alert users that a player is making below the minimum

AC:

* When a player with MLS has an Add C that is below the Minimum Minor League Salary LRD (system value), there will be a flag displayed in the flag column of the BOCâ€™s Addendum C widget
** To calculate find the weekly value of the MJ Minimum: (Min MN Salary / 186) * 7. 
** If the playerâ€™s AAA weekly salary is greater than the MN weekly value, do nothing.
** If the playerâ€™s AAA weekly salary is greater than the MN weekly value, set flag.
* The flag will read:
** Player has MLS and salary is below the MN Minimum.

title: As a Partner Portal API user I want an endpoint which returns matches for a player
custom_steps:
We will expose the existing matching logic to API users via a new POST endpoint:

ebis2-partner-services/api/player/matches

The endpoint will only return matches 85% or higher (this may change as we go so it will be configurable via database)

The endpoint will take in last_name, first_name, and date of birth and match using those fields, each worth 30%

Example POST body:

{code:json}{
    "firstName": "alex",
    "lastName" :"baeza",
    "dateOfBirthAsString": "1998-04-03"
}{code}

and will return a simplified version of the matching list, example:

{code:json}{
    "matches": [
        {
            "partnerClubInfoId": 2363,
            "partnerClubName": "Boise Hawks",
            "partnerLeagueId": 20,
            "partnerLeague": "Pioneer League",
            "mlbClubName": null,
            "mlbOrgCode": null,
            "mlbOrgName": null,
            "personId": 5009366,
            "position": "1B",
            "battingSide": "Left",
            "throwingSide": "Left",
            "firstName": "Alejandro",
            "lastName": "Baeza",
            "birthCountry": "United States",
            "middleName": "Jose",
            "rosterFirstName": "Alex",
            "extendedLastName": null,
            "suffix": null,
            "height": 77,
            "weight": 235,
            "uniformNumber": "",
            "currentVisaFlag": false,
            "visaFlag": false,
            "birthCity": "Van Nuys",
            "birthSector": null,
            "birthDistrict": null,
            "dateOfBirthAsString": "1998-04-03"
        }
    ]
}{code}

title: As a Partner Portal API user I want to see Birth Country and Visa Required field in the League Roster API
custom_steps:
Add Birth Country and Visa Required fields to each player returned on the GET call to the roster endpoint (/ebis2-partner-services-dev.ebis-gcp-npd.mlbinfra.com/ebis2-partner-services/api/league/{leagueid}/rosters)

to return Birth Country and Visa Required fields for each player.

title: As a developer, I want each build and deployment of ebis to automatically break browser caches
custom_steps:
The build process for ebis should update a cachebuster with each build to enforce a redownload of all javascript and css files. 

Files to invalidate: main.js, ebislogin.js, ebis.css

title: AMT | move to use EBIS Okta Authorization Server
custom_steps:
As a user of both the EBIS Link and AMT applications,

I want to be able to access AMTâ€™s API using tokens granted via EBIS Linkâ€™s authentication API

So that I can programmatically access the API

Note that users will still need the AMT-USER group and either the AMT-CLUB-USER or AMT-BOC-USER groups in okta to access endpoints in the AMT API, however, this change will allow users who have both the EBIS-USER and AMT groups to use the same access token for both applications.

title: Partner League | move to use EBIS Okta Authorization Server
custom_steps:
As a user of both the EBIS Link and Partner applications,

I want to be able to access Partnerâ€™s API using tokens granted via EBIS Linkâ€™s authentication API

So that I can programmatically access the API



Note that users will still need the Partner-portal-user group in okta to access endpoints in the Partner API, however, this change will allow users who have both the EBIS-USER and Partner-portal-user groups to use the same access token for both applications.

title: As a developer I only want the social media batch to delete accounts that were created by BAM and no longer exist
custom_steps:
Currently the social media batch will delete any records that no longer exist in the BAM end point.

This will be a problem as we expand our social media monitoring to include players from DPL.  We wonâ€™t want accounts entered into DPL to be deleted because they are not in BAM.

custom_steps:
AC:

* The EBIS/DPL API will be updated to consume player entered social media handles and types from DPL

title: As a BOC Admin, I want EBIS to consume Top 300 from DPL
As a BOC Admin, I want EBIS to consume Social Media Consent Fields from DPL
custom_steps:
AC:

* The EBIS/DPL API will be updated to consume the Consent Fields
* This will drive player populations and consent information of domestic amateurs in the Social Media Monitoring widget

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the Social Media Tracking Widget Updated to Accomodate Domestic Amateurs
custom_steps:
AC:

* Dropdown filter to switch between Professional and Domestic Amateurs
** Defaults to Professional (assuming permissions to both)
* Clubs will see any players they have Origins on for the current draft year
* There will be a Top 300 list column to indicate if the player has been flagged as a Top 300 player

title: As a GCM Admin, I want the GCM Slackbot to access the Eligible for Dugout lists
custom_steps:
AC:

* While using the GCM slackbot, users will be able to enter a slash command and retrieve the specified Orgâ€™s Eligible for Dugout list for the current day
* The slash command will be in the format of â€œ/dugout + Org Codeâ€�
** Example: /dugout NYM
* The data retrieved will be â€˜liveâ€™ and reflect what is currently entered in ebis

title: BO Okta Authentication for eBIS Reporting/Printing
custom_steps:
Please review the BO API information so we can leverage Okta authentication for BO reporting in eBIS rather than LDAP authentication

Per Charles, we will want a particular account to have the minimum rights to update user groups directly in eBIS

----

Business Intelligence Platform RESTful Web Service Developer Guide ; Authentication starts on pg 37

[https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_BUSINESSOBJECTS_BUSINESS_INTELLIGENCE_PLATFORM/db6a17[â€¦]onfguration%20for%20REST%20Endpoint&version=4.3.2&locale=en-US|https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_BUSINESSOBJECTS_BUSINESS_INTELLIGENCE_PLATFORM/db6a17c0d1214fd6971de66ea0122378/8c048fa130ef45238adcf34f5dcb9d3f.html?q=SAML%20Confguration%20for%20REST%20Endpoint&version=4.3.2&locale=en-US]

title: Invalidate all old static file caches (html, css, js) on new releases
custom_steps: We put in a temporary fix for the 2022.10 release for login.html and ebisLogin.js, but for future releases, we should ensure that all static files are not cached by the browser. The easiest way to accomplish this would be to include the build version in the filename (or as an unused query parameter when downloading the file, e.g. ?version=2023.1)

title: Test EBIS TRN Connection to BO
As a BOC User, I want to send a player memo via Text
custom_steps:
AC:
 - When a player memo is sent, EBIS will send the memo to all players via Text using the MLB Official Contact Info
 - Deliveries and failures will be logged and available for download
